description.narrative: More children and their families in targeted vulnerable communities access basic sanitation facilities and adopt adequate hygiene practices, which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, more children and their families are living in an open defecation free environment, using improved drinking water sources and adopting improved hygiene practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: More children and their families in targeted vulnerable communities access basic sanitation facilities and adopt adequate hygiene practices

description.narrative: Through the Community Led Total Sanitation approach, 454 communities were certified as ODF representing 303% of the targeted 150 ODF communities. Around 509,310 community members constructed and used sanitation facilities and are living in certified ODF communities. Of these, 242,097 gained access to basic sanitation representing 48% of the basic sanitation target. New evidence was generated on the effective contribution of Faecal Sludge Management towards addressing broader issues of safely managed sanitation services. Private Public Partnerships (PPP) initiated for the management of cost-effective sanitation facilities in public places which will contribute to the improving sanitation coverage constrained by affordability issues. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
